DOC.brief_title: Maximal Use Systemic Exposure ( MUSE ) Study Levulan Kerastick
DOC.criteria: At least 6 Grade 1/2 AKs one upper extremity AND At least 12 Grade 1/2 AKs OTHER upper extremity Pregnancy history cutaneous photosensitization , porphyria , hypersensitivity porphyrin photodermatosis lesion suspicious skin cancer ( skin cancer rule biopsy ) untreated skin cancer within Treatment Area Body Mass Index ( BMI ) > 32.0 kg/m2 skin pathology condition could interfere evaluation test product require use interfere topical systemic therapy significant blood loss within 60 day donate blood/plasma within 72 hour prior Visit 2 ( Baseline ) test positive screening human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) know seropositive HIV history lead poison history significant exposure lead screen lead level 6Î¼g/dl test positive screening hepatitis B surface antigen , hepatitis C antibody history positive result positive drug screen Screening Screening safety lab clinically significant opinion investigator major surgery within 30 day prior Visit 2 ( Baseline ) plan surgery study Subject immunosuppressed currently enrol investigational drug device study receive investigational drug treat investigational device within 30 day prior Visit 2 ( Baseline ) know sensitivity one vehicle component ( ethyl alcohol , isopropyl alcohol , laureth 4 , polyethylene glycol ) use follow topical preparation extremity treat : Keratolytics include urea ( great 5 % ) , alpha hydroxyacids [ e.g.glycolic acid , lactic acid , etc . great 5 % ] , salicylic acid ( great 2 % ) within 2 day initiation treatment Cryotherapy within 2 week initiation treatment Retinoids , include tazarotene , adapalene , tretinoin , retinol , within 4 week initiation treatment Microdermabrasion , laser ablative treatment , ALAPDT , chemical peel , 5FU , diclofenac , imiquimod topical treatment AK within 8 week initiation treatment use systemic retinoid therapy within 6 month initiation treatment
